availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joshua West Jacobs (Boyle County, Kentucky, captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, soldier. Boyle County, Kentucky, native. Son of John Adamson Jacobs and Susan Walker Fry Powell Jacobs. Attended school in Boyle County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Instructor in 1860. Attended Centre College in Boyle County from 1860 to 1861. Household owned six enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private, sergeant major, first lieutenant, and captain from October 8, 1861, to August 17, 1865. Wounded at the Battle of Chickamauga in Walker County, Georgia, on September 19, 1863. Captured at the Battle of Atlanta in Atlanta on July 31, 1864. Prisoner of war from July 31, 1864 to March 10, 1865. Paroled at Camp Parole in Annapolis, Maryland, on March 10, 1865.
